intro: Salsola kali var. pontica, commonly known as Russian thistle or goatweed, is a flowering plant in the Amaranthaceae family. It is a perennial shrub that typically grows in arid and semi-arid regions, characterized by its spiny stems and small, fleshy leaves. The plant produces pink to purple flowers that bloom in summer, and it is well adapted to harsh environmental conditions. It is often found in disturbed soils, such as along roadsides and in agricultural fields. Due to its invasive nature in some areas, it can outcompete native vegetation and is considered a weed in many regions.
